intro: Scleranthus orzinii, commonly known as the Armenian thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, branching stems with small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Scleranthus orzinii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
